xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas
Class ImplementorBasedSweepArea<E>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas.AbstractSweepArea<E>
      xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas.ImplementorBasedSweepArea<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
SweepArea<E>, MemoryMonitorable, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
HeapSA, ListSA, Orenstein.OrensteinSA, PlaneSweep.PlaneSA, SortMergeEquiJoinSA, SortMergeJoin.PredicateBasedSA, TemporalDistinct.TemporalDistinctSA
public class ImplementorBasedSweepArea<E>
extends AbstractSweepArea<E>

A SweepArea is a highly dynamic datastructure with flexible insertion, retrieval and reorganization capabilities. It is utilized to remain the state of an operation.
This abstract implementation relies on the design pattern Bridge with the intention to "decouple an abstraction from its implementation so that the two can vary independently". For further information see: "Gamma et al.: DesignPatterns. Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software. Addision Wesley 1998."

See Also:
SweepAreaImplementor, SortMergeJoin, MultiWaySortMergeJoin, Predicate, RightBind, Iterator

Field Detail

impl

protected final SweepAreaImplementor<E> impl
The underlying implementor.

ID

protected final int ID
The ID of this SweepArea.

selfReorganize

protected final boolean selfReorganize
This flag determines if this SweepArea can reorganize itself. To trigger this event, the ID passed to the reorganize call has to be identical with the internal ID of this SweepArea.

queryPredicates

protected final Predicate<? super E>[] queryPredicates
Binary predicates used to query this SweepArea and its underlying SweepAreaImplementor, respectively. To offer a retrieval depending on the ID passed to the query calls, a SweepArea requires such an array of predicates.

removePredicates

protected final Predicate<? super E>[] removePredicates
Binary predicates determining if an element of a SweepArea and its underlying SweepAreaImplementor, respectively, can be removed. To offer a removal depending on the ID passed to the reorganization or expiration calls, a SweepArea requires such an array of predicates.

removeRightBinds

protected final RightBind<E>[] removeRightBinds
The default implementation removes all expired elements from a SweepArea by sequentially iterating over all elements. The iteration is performed by a Filter applying an unary selection predicate. For this purpose, the constructors of this class wrap the array of binary remove-predicates to an array of unary remove-predicates removeRightBinds. The element passed to the reorganization and expiration, respectively, is implicitly set as right argument.

Constructor Detail

ImplementorBasedSweepArea

public ImplementorBasedSweepArea(SweepAreaImplementor<E> impl,
                                 int ID,
                                 boolean selfReorganize,
                                 Predicate<? super E>[] queryPredicates,
                                 Predicate<? super E>[] removePredicates,
                                 int objectSize)
Constructs a new SweepArea.

Parameters:
impl - The underlying implementor.
ID - The ID of this SweepArea.
selfReorganize - A flag to determine if this SweepArea can reorganize itself.
queryPredicates - An array of binary query-predicates used to probe this SweepArea. Depending on the ID passed to the query-call, different query-predicates can be chosen for retrieval.
removePredicates - An array of binary remove-predicates utilized during the reorganization. With the help of this predicates, the elements of a SweepArea are probed for expiration. In analogy to the query-predicates, the predicate actually applied to this SweepArea depends on the ID passed to the expiration and reorganization call, respectively.
objectSize - The object size of the elements in the sweeparea.

ImplementorBasedSweepArea

public ImplementorBasedSweepArea(SweepAreaImplementor<E> impl,
                                 int ID,
                                 boolean selfReorganize,
                                 Predicate<? super E>[] queryPredicates,
                                 Predicate<? super E>[] removePredicates)
Constructs a new SweepArea. Sets objectSize to unknown. The object size will be determined with reflection during the first insert() call.

Parameters:
impl - The underlying implementor.
ID - The ID of this SweepArea.
selfReorganize - A flag to determine if this SweepArea can reorganize itself.

removePredicates - An array of binary remove-predicates utilized during the reorganization. With the help of this predicates, the elements of a SweepArea are probed for expiration. In analogy to the query-predicates, the predicate actually applied to this SweepArea depends on the ID passed to the expiration and reorganization call, respectively.

removePredicate - Default predicate for reorganization, which is applied independently from the ID passed to reorganization and expiration calls.
objectSize - The object size of the elements in the sweeparea.

ImplementorBasedSweepArea

public ImplementorBasedSweepArea(SweepAreaImplementor<E> impl,
                                 int ID,
                                 boolean selfReorganize,
                                 Predicate<? super E>[] queryPredicates)
Constructs a new SweepArea, but performs no reorganization. This is achieved by internally reorganizing with Predicates.FALSE. Sets objectSize to unknown. The object size will be determined with reflection during the first insert() call.

ImplementorBasedSweepArea

public ImplementorBasedSweepArea(SweepAreaImplementor<E> impl,
                                 int ID,
                                 boolean selfReorganize,
                                 Predicate<? super E> queryPredicate,
                                 Predicate<? super E> removePredicate,
                                 int dim,
                                 int objectSize)
Constructs a new SweepArea with a generally applicable query- and reorganization predicate. Sets objectSize to unknown. The object size will be determined with reflection during the first insert() call.

Parameters:
impl - The underlying implementor.
ID - The ID of this SweepArea.
selfReorganize - A flag to determine if this SweepArea can reorganize itself.
queryPredicate - A generally applicable binary query-predicate used to probe this SweepArea. Hence, this predicate is applied independently from the ID passed to query calls.
removePredicate - A generally applicable binary remove-predicates utilized during the reorganization. With the help of this predicates, the elements of a SweepArea are probed for expiration. This predicate is applied independently from the ID passed to reorganization and expiration calls.
dim - The dimensionality of this SweepArea, i.e., the number of possible inputs or in other words the number of different IDs that can be passed to method calls of this SweepArea.
objectSize - The object size of the elements in the sweeparea.

ImplementorBasedSweepArea

                                 int ID,
                                 boolean selfReorganize,

Constructs a new SweepArea with a generally applicable query- and reorganization predicate. This SweepArea performs no reorganization. This is achieved by internally reorganizing with Predicates.FALSE. Sets objectSize to unknown. The object size will be determined with reflection during the first insert() call.

Parameters:
impl - The underlying implementor.

selfReorganize - A flag to determine if this SweepArea can reorganize itself.
queryPredicate - A generally applicable binary query-predicate used to probe this SweepArea. Hence, this predicate is applied independently from the ID passed to query calls.
dim - The dimensionality of this SweepArea, i.e., the number of possible inputs or in other words the number of different IDs that can be passed to method calls of this SweepArea.

ImplementorBasedSweepArea

public ImplementorBasedSweepArea(SweepAreaImplementor<E> impl,
                                 int ID,
                                 int dim)
Constructs a new SweepArea with a generally applicable query- and reorganization predicate. This SweepArea uses Equal.DEFAULT_INSTANCE for querying and new Not(Equal.DEFAULT_INSTANCE) for reorganization. A self-reorganization is permitted. Sets objectSize to unknown. The object size will be determined with reflection during the first insert() call.

Parameters:
impl - The underlying implementor.
ID - The ID of this SweepArea.
dim - The dimensionality of this SweepArea, i.e., the number of possible inputs or in other words the number of different IDs that can be passed to method calls of this SweepArea.
Method Detail

insert

public void insert(E o)
            throws IllegalArgumentException
Inserts the given element into this SweepArea. The default implementation simply forwards this call to the underlying implementor. Thus, it calls impl.insert(o).

Clears this SweepArea by clearing the underlying implementor. Calls impl.clear().
This method should remove all elements of a SweepArea, but holds its allocated resources.

query

public Iterator<E> query(E o,
                         int ID)
                  throws IllegalArgumentException
Queries this SweepArea with the help of the specified query object o. Returns all matching elements as an iterator. The default implementation of this method directly passes the call to the underlying implementor, i.e., it returns impl.query(o, ID).
Note: This iterator should not be used to remove any elements of a SweepArea!

Specified by:
query in interface SweepArea<E>
Specified by:
query in class AbstractSweepArea<E>
Parameters:
o - The query object. This object is typically probed against the elements contained in this SweepArea.
ID - An ID determining from which input this method is triggered.
Returns:
All matching elements of this SweepArea are returned as an iterator.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - Throws an IllegalArgumentException if something goes wrong due to the passed arguments during retrieval.

query

public Iterator<E> query(E[] os,
                         int[] IDs,
                         int valid)
                  throws IllegalArgumentException
Queries this SweepArea with the help of the specified query objects os. Returns all matching elements as an iterator. This version of query additionally allows to use partially filled arrays and specifies how many entries of such a partially filled array are valid.
The default implementation of this method directly passes the call to the underlying implementor and returns impl.query(os, IDs, valid).

Specified by:

Specified by:

os - The query objects. These objects are typically probed against the elements contained in this SweepArea.
IDs - IDs determining from which input the query objects come from.
valid - Determines how many entries at the beginning of os and IDs are valid and therefore taken into account.
Returns:
All matching elements of this SweepArea are returned as an iterator.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - Throws an IllegalArgumentException if something goes wrong due to the passed arguments during retrieval.

expire

public Iterator<E> expire(E currentStatus,
                          int ID)
                   throws UnsupportedOperationException,
                          IllegalStateException
Determines which elements in this SweepArea expire with respect to the object currentStatus and an ID. The latter is commonly used to differ by which input this reorganization step is initiated.
If no elements qualify for removal, an empty cursor is returned and all elements are remained.
In order to remove the expired elements, either the returned iterator has to support and execute the remove operation for each expired element during traversal or the reorganize(Object, int) has to be overwritten to perform the final removal.

The default implementation in this class performs a sequential scan: 

        new Remover(new Filter(iterator(), removeRightBinds[ID].setRight(currentStatus)));
Hence, specialized SweepAreas should overwrite this method to gain a more efficient reorganization.

Specified by:
expire in interface SweepArea<E>
Specified by:
expire in class AbstractSweepArea<E>
Parameters:
currentStatus - The object containing the necessary information to detect expired elements.
ID - An ID determining from which input this method is triggered.
Returns:
an iteration over the elements which expire with respect to the object currentStatus and an ID.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - An UnsupportedOperationException is thrown, if this method is not supported by this SweepArea.
IllegalStateException - Throws an IllegalStateException if this method is called at an invalid state.

reorganize

public void reorganize(E currentStatus,
                       int ID)
                throws UnsupportedOperationException,
                       IllegalStateException
In contrast to the method expire(Object, int), this method removes all expired elements from a SweepArea without returning them. The default implementation removes all elements returned by a call to expire(Object, int).
In order to perform a more efficient removal, this method should be overwritten, e.g., by implementing a bulk deletion.

Specified by:
reorganize in interface SweepArea<E>
Specified by:
reorganize in class AbstractSweepArea<E>
Parameters:
currentStatus - The object containing the necessary information to perform the reorganization step.
ID - An ID determining from which input this reorganization step is triggered.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - An UnsupportedOperationException is thrown, if is method is not supported by this SweepArea.
IllegalStateException - Throws an IllegalStateException if this method is called at an invalid state.

allowsSelfReorganize

public boolean allowsSelfReorganize()
Returns true if this SweepArea permits self-reorganization. In this case, the ID passed to the reorganize call is the same as the internal ID of this SweepArea. Otherwise false is returned.

Returns:
True if this SweepArea permits self-reorganization, otherwise false.
